Title: Data Centre Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC’s Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!

Summary

Responsibilities

The Data Centre Analyst is responsible for the maintenance and operations of all data centre facilities across the enterprise. Plans, schedules, and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities, from the Data Centre to communication closets, while adhering to established IT change management policies and procedures. Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system. Develops and maintains documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre. Mitigates operational and system risks in alignment with enterprise risk management and ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure statistical data. Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle. Develops and refines Data Centre practices to follow accepted best practices.

Duties And Responsibilities

Plans, schedules, and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities ranging from the Data Centre to communication closets. These activities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Analyzes the ongoing performance of the Data Centre infrastructure including servers, storage and supporting systems to ensure optimal operation,

Assesses system power and cooling requirements at all sites and develop plans to increase the efficiency of those sites through a reduction in the consumption of both power and cooling,

Manages the support call lifecycle with infrastructure vendors in support of both component failures and analysis indicating component performance issues,

Provides expertise in the process of racking of network equipment, servers and storage according to data centre best practices.

Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system by:

Analyzes schedule policies and makes adjustments to backup windows as needed relative to the requirements of the business,

Recommends best practices and advancements that support the current IT strategy,

Monitors system health and daily backup jobs, performs on-demand restores of business data and the configuration of agents on computer systems.

Develops and maintains comprehensive documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre. Documentation includes run books for all infrastructure components describing routine maintenance activities, standard operating procedures and system configurations.

Mitigates Operational And System Risk By

Analyzes operating system patches and system and storage firmware upgrades in support of enterprise risk management,

Plans and scheduling firmware upgrades and operating system patches with input from other BT teams to mitigate identified risks and within the parameters of the enterprise change management process,

Coordinates the testing of infrastructure components in collaboration with other enterprise teams,

Responds to emergency call-outs for immediate operational support as required.

Ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure as follows:

Develops infrastructure capacity monitoring programs to provide accurate forecasting and planning information,

Establishes KPIs to provide accurate dashboard information,

Monitors enterprise resource consumption and creates trending analysis for storage and servers,

Tracks power and cooling and summarizes consumption trends for dashboard reporting,

Summarizes status providing monthly dashboard reporting including, but not limited to, power and cooling usage and infrastructure capacities.

Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle as follows:

Remains current on technology roadmaps and provides recommendations to the IT Operations management team related to the infrastructure replacement program,

Plans and schedules the introduction of new infrastructure into the Data Centre to review the changing technologies and determine suitability in the enterprise environment,

Prepares the configuration of infrastructure components for the enterprise procurement process,

Ensures assets, including racks, servers, storage, appliances and cabling are accurately recorded in the current asset management system,

Monitors the infrastructure equipment through the current asset management system.

Develops And Refines Data Centre Practices As Follows

Reviews current processes and procedures, identifies limitations, recommends and implements improvements,

Ensures the enterprise remains current on best practices and trends in data centre management,

Creates, reviews and maintains documentation in support of data centre best practices,

Contributes to the development of the Data Centre workplans.

Performs related duties as assigned, such being items of a minor nature that do not affect the value of the job.

Education

Qualifications

Requires a diploma in computer science from a recognized institute of technology specializing in network configuration and administration, and computer hardware systems.

Experience

Requires three (3) years previous experience in an information technology environment involving the installation, maintenance, operations, troubleshooting and support of corporate network and hardware systems, including one (1) year in a Data Centre environment supporting relevant power management, cooling and operation specific systems. A further period of up to one (1) year on the job is required to become thoroughly familiar with the enterprise architecture plan, IS policies and standards, the enterprise Data Centre and specific network and hardware components.

Additional Requirements

Candidate must hold a valid class 5 driver’s license.

Ability to lift and maneuver objects up to 50 lbs.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

Salary $8,236.33 - $9,896.62 per month (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: April 17, 2025

Closing Date: Open until filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

TransLink is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Digital
Description:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Data & Analytics Department is to maximize the value of Aritzia’s data by making it available, insightful and actionable to foster a culture of data-driven decision making.




THE OPPORTUNITY

As a member of the Data & Analytics Department supporting Digital, you will be part of the team that bridges the gap between business strategy and data. As a Sr. Data Analyst, Advanced Analytics at Aritzia, you will combine your deep understanding of digital customer experiences with your passion for data and masterful analytics skills to enable data-driven experiences that will create long lasting relationships with our customers and drive outcomes for our Digital business. And, with the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Analytics to continued growth and development with Aritzia.




THE ROLE

As the Sr. Data Analyst, Advanced Analytics, you will:

Partner and innovate with business leaders to deeply understand or identify the strategic opportunities across eCommerce, Retail, and other cross-functional divisions
Define measurement strategies to quantify the performance of various customer programs and compare their current condition against a hindsight benchmark
Support with generating actionable insights by analyzing customer behaviour, through diagnostics, correlations, and hypothesis testing to grow the business and enhance customer experience
Clearly and accurately visualize and communicate data and analytics through reports, dashboards, and presentations to maximize strategic decisions




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Sr. Data Analyst, Advanced Analytics has:

An understanding and passion for the industry we operate in, preferably a background in eCommerce and/or Digital
Proven skills, education and/or applicable certifications in:
SQL
Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
Python
R or related statistical analysis tools
Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
A commitment to learn, apply, champion and enrich Aritzia's Values and Business and People Leadership principles
The skills to collaborate strategically with cross-functional partners in the pursuit of operational efficiency, continuous growth, and shared business outcomes
The ability to understand and transform complex business problems into data & analytics requirements




THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Additionally, this position may be eligible for bonus.




We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon salary may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.




Aritzia’s Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.




THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

Product Discount – Maybe you’ve heard of our famous product discount? Or our exclusive private shopping events? You have now.
A-OK Commissary & Café – Everyday Luxury dining, exclusive to Aritzia. Our in-house bistro and café is a private oasis where employees can enjoy curated, subsidized Everyday Luxury dining.
The SET – Our in-office fitness studio and gym with state-of-the-art equipment, custom-created classes, and optional personal training. Open 7 days a week, works out well.
Aritzia Virtual Wellness – Because your health, happiness, and safety matter – 24/7 resources to support you in your wellbeing goals, be it physical, mental, social, or financial.
Aspirational Workplace – Our offices are specially designed to be spaces of creativity, productivity, and inspiration. They’re also dog friendly. Woof.
Amenities – Additional amenities include a private parent’s room, shower facilities with elevated complementary conveniences, bike rooms, and more.
The Extras – We also offer a multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and on-site medical care.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to take your career to the next level with a leading company in the telecommunications industry? America Fujikura Limited (AFL) is on the hunt for dynamic, Junior Data Analystto join our Canadian Operations.

We are looking for a Junior Data Analystwith a strong computer science background to join our team. This role is ideal for a recent graduate or someone with up to 2 years of professional experience in software development. The ideal candidate will have a solid foundation in software engineering principles, object-oriented programming (OOP), and web development. While prior experience with Dynamics 365 or Power Platform is not required, an interest in learning business applications and cloud-based solutions is a plus.

Key Responsibilities


Software Development & Customization
Support the execution of solving business challenges using the Power Platform and O365.
Maintain and develop Power BI reports for the PMO.
Integrate data between internal and external systems (Customers)
Work on both front-end and back-end components of web applications.
Assist in developing and optimizing REST APIs and integrating applications.
Participate in the software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, coding, testing, and deployment.


Data & System Integration


Work with relational databases such as SQL Server to manage and query data.
Assist in integrating different systems using APIs and cloud-based services.
Learn and implement Microsoft technologies such as Power Platform, Azure Functions, and Dataverse.


Testing & Quality Assurance


Support user acceptance testing (UAT) and troubleshoot issues.
Follow best practices for code quality, security, and performance.


Learning & Growth


Gain hands-on experience with Microsoft technologies, including Power Platform, Dynamics 365, and Azure.
Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends.
Participate in team discussions, technical workshops, and code reviews.


Qualifications

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
0-2 years of experience in software development (internships, co-ops, or personal projects count!).


Technical Skills


Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language (C#, Java, or Python).
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and database management.
Familiarity with SQL databases and writing efficient queries.
Understanding of cloud computing concepts (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus).


Soft Skills


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies.
Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
Detail-oriented and organized approach to coding and documentation.


Preferred (but Not Required) Skills


Exposure to Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse).
Basic understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies.
Interest in business applications and enterprise software solutions.


We welcome diversity and encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply!

We provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. If you need accommodations during the application process, contact NSHRCanada@AFLglobal.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity, not discriminating based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability

Title: Data and Insights Analyst
Description:
Why Apply

Work with a growing national team dedicated to reconciliation at the First Nations Financial Management Board (FMB). We support First Nations in developing and implementing sound administrative governance and finance practices, that are fully optional and provided free to First Nations. The FMB was created under the First Nations Fiscal Management Act (“FMA”) in 2006 and has been serving First Nations ever since.

FMB values its staff, and offers flexible work hours, generous extended benefits, vacations, matching RRSP contributions, and opportunities for professional development and career growth. If you want to make the most of your skills and expertise while growing your career, we want to work with you. A career at FMB is an opportunity to be part of a talented, diverse, and inclusive team doing transformative work on a national scale.

Position Overview

Reporting to the Data & Analytics Manager, the Data and Insights Analyst strengthens relationships with FMB’s Indigenous clients by translating data into clear, actionable insights. Clients may include First Nations governments and Indigenous organizations. This role will cultivate partnerships among FMB divisions and clients to pinpoint the data and visualization needs that matter most to FMB’s Indigenous clients.

In every engagement this role champions data storytelling and evidence-based decision-making, ensuring insights drive real-world impacts for Indigenous communities. Drawing on client needs, the analyst designs, builds, and refines interactive Power BI dashboards and other data-driven products, managing each project from discovery through deployment while coordinating with other FMB team members.

Accountabilities


Relationship Development
Build trust and maintain ongoing dialogue with Indigenous clients to understand community priorities and ensure data solutions reflect local contexts
Collaborate with members of FMB’s Data & Analytics Committee to develop data tools and visualizations that meet the needs of FMB’s clients
Needs Assessment & Solution Design
Facilitate discovery sessions to gather requirements for dashboards and reports
Translate business questions into data models and intuitive visual designs
Data Visualization & Analysis
Write robust SQL queries to extract and prepare data
Develop, publish, and maintain Power BI Reports (along with other data visualization tools), ensuring accessibility and performance for end-users
Apply statistical or geospatial techniques to uncover patterns and forecast trends
Project and Workflow Management
Create detailed project plans and timelines
Coordinate with members of FMB’s data team and other divisions to establish time budgets for projects
Track progress on client adoption and use of data visualization tools
Capacity Building & Knowledge Sharing
Develop and deliver virtual training sessions for FMB’s clients about using data visualization tools, dashboards, and reports
Host quarterly “lunch-and-learn” sessions for FMB personnel that showcase new dashboards, share lessons learned, and invite feedback from cross-functional teams
Collaborate with FMB’s Capacity Development team to incorporate data literacy modules into FMB’s broader client training offerings

The Data and Insights Analyst may perform other tasks and duties as assigned by the Data & Analytics Manager.

Qualifications


Education: University Degree in data science, computer science, statistics, business, economics, business analytics, or relevant field; a graduate degree in such fields would be an asset.
Experience: Minimum five (5) years in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role.
Experience working with Indigenous governments or organizations is preferred.
Technical skills:
Proficient in SQL
Advanced expertise in Power BI development, with strong proficiency in DAX
Working knowledge of at least one additional coding language (e.g., Python, R, Stata, etc.)
Familiarity with Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Factory, and SSMS
Other skills:
Ability to build respectful, collaborative relationships with Indigenous leadership and staff
Excellent written and verbal communication – able to explain technical issues with non-technical audiences
Strong organizational and project-management abilities; comfortable with working on multiple projects and setting priorities
Must be fluent in English (spoken and written); fluency in French an asset
Experience collaborating and communicating with senior leaders in an organization
Experience working in teams with diverse skills and experiences
Must have an understanding, awareness and appreciation of Indigenous culture and history

An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Working Conditions


This position can be based in West Vancouver, BC, Winnipeg, MB, Ottawa, ON or Montreal QC; remote or hybrid working may be considered.
May require occasional national travel.


What We Offer


Salary and annual bonus eligibility;
Flexible 37.5-hour work week
Employer paid extended benefits;
Matching group RPP contributions;
Annual vacation allowance and generous paid stat & non-stat days;
Work-life balance;
Professional development & career growth opportunities.


FMB is an equal opportunity employer that recognizes and celebrates the diversity of all First Nations and people across Canada. We are an inclusive organization that treats all employees equally. As a First Nations Organization, applicants of Indigenous descent will be given preference.

FMB is an equal opportunity employer that recognizes and celebrates the diversity of all First Nations and people across Canada. We are an inclusive organization that treats all employees equally. As a First Nations Organization, applicants of Indigenous descent will be given preference.

Title: Microsoft Power BI Analyst
Description:
New Value Solutions, a national IT consulting company, is seeking a Functional Analyst: Microsoft Power BI, SSRS and SSIS to deliver advanced dashboard reporting solutions.




Responsibilities

Develop, support, and optimize Power BI dashboards.
Implement and maintain ETL workflows using SSRS and SSIS.
Support departmental reporting across diverse City departments.
Conduct rigorous testing and performance tuning.
Document processes and provide training to end-users.




Requirements

Extensive experience with Power BI, SSRS, and SSIS.
Expertise in data visualization and ETL processes.
Proven analytical, documentation, and troubleshooting capabilities.
Excellent communication and user support skills.




If you have the necessary expertise and able to work in Canada, please submit your resume. While we thank all candidates in advance for their application, only those shortlisted will be contacted.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Raymond James, we develop, we collaborate, we decide, we deliver, and we improve together .

Raymond James Ltd. is Canada’s leading independent investment dealers offering high quality investment products and services to Canadians seeking customized solutions to their wealth management needs.

Senior Data Analyst

How Does The Role Impact The Organization?

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst. Reporting to the Manager, Reporting and Analytics of the Enterprise Data team the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and building business intelligence and data integration solutions.

The Senior Data Analyst at Raymond James will help the organization to become more data driven by assisting the business in turning data into information, turning information into insight and insight into decisions. The analyst will conduct full lifecycle activities including requirements analysis, data analysis, data modeling, design, and development of data solutions.

What Will Your Role Be Responsible For?


Interpret business and data requirements after eliciting the problem that needs to be solved.
Design and implement scalable data and business intelligence solutions such as dashboards, reports, semantic models, extracts, and other data products that solve the business problem.
Collaborate with team members of the Enterprise Data team to identify data sources, relationships between data sources and build data pipelines that are required to solve the business requirements.
Coach and mentor other analysts on the team on best practices in data analysis and designing robust solutions.
Contribute to the overall enterprise data architecture, design, and process improvement.
Document requirements, solution design, process/data flows, data lineage and other technical specifications.
Create roadmaps for long term projects and data solutions.
Design solutions for analyzing large historical and multidimensional data.
Profile data sources using SQL and other data discovery tools in support of data quality analysis and business intelligence design efforts.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


What Can You Expect From Us?

Our most important investment is in people. Upon eligibility, Raymond James Ltd offers flexible workstyles, a competitive compensation and benefits package. Our benefits range from Health Benefits, RRSP Matching Program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Paid Time Off, Volunteer Days, Discretionary Bonuses, Tuition Reimbursement and many more! We also support internal promotion and community involvement.

What Do We Expect From You?


Proficiency in understanding and creating data models, data profiling, data mapping, data mining and data segmentation techniques.
Proficiency in design and development of Power BI dashboards based on best practice design principles, data visualizations and efficient data models.
Excellent SQL skills with capability to write complex and efficient queries.
Capability to work with data from variety of sources and formats such as JSON via APIs, SQL, flat files etc.
Identify and understand issues, problems, and opportunities; analyze and compare data from different sources to identify patterns, issues and draw conclusions.
Advocate for improvements to processes, architecture, data quality, data governance, efficient design, and overall high standards in the team.
Strong verbal and written communication skills. Clearly convey information, insights, and ideas through a variety of media stakeholders in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
Collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate complex information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; understand business context, goals, develop and sustain productive client relationships.


Education and experience:


Diploma of Technology, bachelor’s degree in computer science, MIS, Business, or a related field preferred.
6+ years of experience in a business intelligence focused role leveraging Power BI, DAX and SQL.
2+ years of experience in cloud solutions such as Power BI service, Azure Synapse/Microsoft Fabric.
2+ years of experience working with API calls and JSON data to integrate with core data platforms or build dashboards/reports.
2+ years of experience in financial services industry preferably wealth management or investment banking sectors.
Demonstrated experience in using Python/R libraries for data analysis, data cleansing as well as production scale solutions.
Database/Data warehouse design and development experience is an asset.
Experience in an agile environment shipping products incrementally and iteratively.


We encourage our associates at all levels to:


Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same.
Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes.
Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind.
Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter.
Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm.


At Raymond James – we honor, value, respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic self, our organization, clients and communities thrive, it is part of our part of our people-first culture. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs.

Here at Raymond James we demonstrate our commitment to ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates. To request accommodations, candidates are instructed to contact Human Resources via email at recruitment@raymondjames.ca. By reaching out to this email address, candidates can communicate their specific requirements and discuss the necessary accommodations they may need to participate fully in the recruitment process.

Salary Range: BC (based on Education, Work Experience, etc) $105,000-115,000 in addition to competitive performance bonuses/incentives.

Job

Technology

Primary Location

CA-BC-Burnaby-Burnaby

Other Locations

CA-ON-Toronto-Toronto

Organization

IT

Schedule

Full-time

Status

Permanent Full-Time

  • Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; understand business context, goals, develop and sustain productive client relationships.

Education and experience:

  • Diploma of Technology, bachelor’s degree in computer science, MIS, Business, or a related field preferred.
  • 6+ years of experience in a business intelligence focused role leveraging Power BI, DAX and SQL.
  • 2+ years of experience in cloud solutions such as Power BI service, Azure Synapse/Microsoft Fabric.
  • 2+ years of experience working with API calls and JSON data to integrate with core data platforms or build dashboards/reports.
  • 2+ years of experience in financial services industry preferably wealth management or investment banking sectors.
  • Demonstrated experience in using Python/R libraries for data analysis, data cleansing as well as production scale solutions.
  • Database/Data warehouse design and development experience is an asset.
  • Experience in an agile environment shipping products incrementally and iteratively.

We encourage our associates at all levels to:

  • Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same.
  • Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind.
  • Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter.
  • Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm.

At Raymond James – we honor, value, respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic self, our organization, clients and communities thrive, it is part of our part of our people-first culture. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs.

Here at Raymond James we demonstrate our commitment to ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates. To request accommodations, candidates are instructed to contact Human Resources via email at recruitment@raymondjames.ca. By reaching out to this email address, candidates can communicate their specific requirements and discuss the necessary accommodations they may need to participate fully in the recruitment process.

Salary Range: BC (based on Education, Work Experience, etc) $105,000-115,000 in addition to competitive performance bonuses/incentives.

Primary Location

CA-BC-Burnaby-Burnaby

Other Locations

CA-ON-Toronto-Toronto

Organization

Schedule

Status

Permanent Full-Time

Title: Data Analytics Associate
Description:
About Us

RB Global (NYSE: RBA) (TSX: RBA) is a leading, omnichannel marketplace that provides value-added insights, services and transaction solutions for buyers and sellers of commercial assets and vehicles worldwide. Through its auction sites in 13 countries and digital platform, RB Global serves customers in more than 170 countries across a variety of asset classes, including automotive, commercial transportation, construction, government surplus, lifting and material handling, energy, mining and agriculture.

The company’s marketplace brands include Ritchie Bros., the world’s largest auctioneer of commercial assets and vehicles offering online bidding, and IAA, a leading global digital marketplace connecting vehicle buyers and sellers. RB Global’s portfolio of brands also includes Rouse Services, which provides a complete end-to-end asset management, data-driven intelligence and performance benchmarking system; SmartEquip, an innovative technology platform that supports customers’ management of the equipment lifecycle and integrates parts procurement with both OEMs and dealers; Xcira, a leader in live simulcast auction technologies; and Veritread, an online marketplace for heavy haul transport.

About The Team

Ritchie Bros. Financial Services is our dynamic, fast-paced and passionate equipment financing business unit. Outgoing, entrepreneurial, collaborative, fun, energetic, resilient, competitive, friendly, customer-focused – we like our coworkers and our adjectives. Our ultimate reward is successfully helping our coworkers achieve and develop within our organization.

Job Description

The Data Analytics Associate serves as a support partner to various department groups and leaders within Ritchie Bros. Financial Services. They provide objective and fact-based analytical reviews to deliver quantitative insights of past performance drivers (descriptive), forecasting of current and future opportunities (predictive), and opportunities to drive positive change (prescriptive). The data analyst will also be responsible for supporting a suite of business intelligence reports to ensure that performance metrics are transparent and accessible.

Responsibilities
Independently execute complex data analysis - structuring analysis, executing analysis, synthesizing results, presenting results. Act as an analytics partner for different department units and functional teams within the organization
Lead / take ownership of data related products - e.g., building report dashboards to support the business and teams
Translate business questions into specific requirements and then deliver meaningful insights through a combination of expert technical skill and deep understanding of the business problem
Execute analysis of the company’s customer and business data, including predictive modeling, forecasting and statistical analysis
Proactively identify solutions for improving the effectiveness of business activities within sales, credit, and funding operations
Routine reporting - Support regular monthly business reporting requirements
Presentation of analysis - convene groups & teams to collaborate on issue or questions
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics
Strong understanding of data analysis including collection, exploration, modeling, interpretation, and communication
Previous experience in creating data visualizations of insights and “self-serve” dashboards / reporting tools
Additional experience in Tableau, Salesforce, KNIME, R, etc. is considered an asset.
Show more

Title: Analyst, Business Analytics - Insights
Description:
Marketing Statement

As the largest operating company in the integrated TransLink enterprise, Coast Mountain Bus Company (CMBC) operates a fleet of clean-fuel conventional and community shuttle buses, zero-emission trolley buses, and passenger ferry SeaBuses in Metro Vancouver, the largest single transit service area in Canada.

At CMBC, one of BC’s Top Employers, we're committed to providing an innovative, healthy, and engaging workforce. This is reflected in our workforce of over 5,500 employees performing over 400 unique jobs, who are committed and empowered to deliver service that attracts nearly 1.1 million passengers daily and connects people, businesses, and communities in the Metro Vancouver region.

We have the important job of helping our passengers get to work, appointments, visiting with family and friends, and back again every day. Metro Vancouver relies on us, and we take that as a point of pride.

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Develops, coordinates and maintains performance measures throughout the organization ensuring alignment with enterprise and corporate goals and objectives, including preparing quarterly reports for the Board of Directors and TransLink. Prepares a variety of analysis and reports to provide accurate and up-to-date information for informed senior management decision making. Provides guidance in Key Performance Indicators (KPI) monitoring and reporting.

Designs and deploys Business Intelligence and Analytics solutions, such as monthly reports and dashboards, to meet CMBC’s business needs and supports the strategy for data-driven decision making by providing support to the Data Governance framework to ensure data being presented is governed and suitable to be used in executive-level decision support.

Key Accountabilities

Provides support related to corporate performance measures ensuring alignment with enterprise and corporate goals and objectives and carries out analysis related to variances in corporate performance measures, recommending best practices to the senior management for problem areas. Assists in providing in-depth analysis and recommendations for senior management decision making.

Establishes and maintains a quality assurance process, including to review all data provider sheets submitted by external contractors monthly, proactively highlight irregularities and follow-up with the data providers, which ensures accuracy and completeness of performance measurement data while also ensuring compliance with company’s standards, policies, processes, regulatory and other related requirements. Provides technical support to the maintenance of custom Extract Transform Load (ETL) solution, as well as continual assessment of metadata reporting to ensure data integrity and quality assurance from collection to reporting.

Liaises with various departments to develop and prepare Business Intelligence (BI) dashboards and periodic reports focused on various corporate performance measures, and KPIs and improvements across all functions. Serves as a central reporting point for the organization, assists in requirements gathering, target setting, report design, delivery and documentation.

Creates and maintains (BI) dashboards/reports to ensure users have the information they need to manage their business, to make decisions and improve service and efficiency. Leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices and provides comparable performance measures from other transit agencies and business enterprises to the concerned stakeholders towards informed decision making.

Prepares quarterly reports for the Board of Directors and TransLink to be reviewed by the manager, indicating performance compared to targets and the previous year(s), and rationale for variances. Prepares ad hoc reports, presentation materials related to performance measurement, and research latest trends, best practices and other related data as assigned.

Identifies business process improvement opportunities across the organization and assists in supporting the development and implementation of a culture of continuous improvement. Participates in corporate business planning and initiatives as needed. Participates in the Data Governance program as needed.

Supports with the designs, implementation, and maintenance of customized data warehouse, business intelligence and analytics (DW/BI&A) technical solutions by contributing to database enhancements, managing updates, and ensuring accurate data mapping for reports, benefitting the Performance Reporting Team and internal clients. Ensures DW/BI&A solutions are fit for purpose and align with standards, policies and supports ongoing Data Governance Program within CMBC. Ensures solutions are scalable, following best practices and Enterprise standards, balancing immediate short-term and long-term benefits.

Stays abreast of new techniques, technologies, and industry trends, and participates in relevant industry events related to Data Governance.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Economics, Statistical Analysis or other relevant business-related fields plus four (4) years of experience with development and analysis of performance measurements, and technical experience in designing, implementing and maintaining data and creating reports in a Business Intelligence environment.

Other Requirements

Solid knowledge of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards

Strong analytical, problem solving and judgment skills to be able to interpret data and identify, diagnose, and resolve KPI related issues

Excellent knowledge of office software, including Microsoft Data Warehouse and BI technologies, both Cloud and on-prem (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI Desktop, PowerBI Report Builder, PowerBI Service, Tableau etc.)

Experience maintaining ETL process using software such as SSIS would be an asset.

Strong time management, organization, verbal and written communication skills

Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities and work in a rapidly changing and dynamic environment with limited supervision

Strong relationship management skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams and management levels

Engaged listener: capable of listening and interpreting stakeholder feedback to understand business processes and identify business issues/objectives

Experience in process improvement or lean methodologies would be considered an asset

Experience supporting a data governance program would be considered an asset

Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence tools

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

The salary for this position ranges from $75,600 - $113,400 per annum. Actual salary offered will be based on education, experience, skills, and qualifications as they relate to the role.

We aim to provide competitive pay that reflects your professional background and expertise. We want to ensure our offer will align with your strengths considering experience, skills, and internal equity to offer a fair and equitable salary. The Total Compensation Package, which includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan as well as other employment offerings will be discussed in detail as your application progresses.

How to Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to https://www.translink.ca/About-Us/Careers.aspx to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: May 09, 2025

Closing Date: Open until filled.

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Coast Mountain Bus Company is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca

Identifies business process improvement opportunities across the organization and assists in supporting the development and implementation of a culture of continuous improvement. Participates in corporate business planning and initiatives as needed. Participates in the Data Governance program as needed.

Supports with the designs, implementation, and maintenance of customized data warehouse, business intelligence and analytics (DW/BI&A) technical solutions by contributing to database enhancements, managing updates, and ensuring accurate data mapping for reports, benefitting the Performance Reporting Team and internal clients. Ensures DW/BI&A solutions are fit for purpose and align with standards, policies and supports ongoing Data Governance Program within CMBC. Ensures solutions are scalable, following best practices and Enterprise standards, balancing immediate short-term and long-term benefits.

Stays abreast of new techniques, technologies, and industry trends, and participates in relevant industry events related to Data Governance.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Economics, Statistical Analysis or other relevant business-related fields plus four (4) years of experience with development and analysis of performance measurements, and technical experience in designing, implementing and maintaining data and creating reports in a Business Intelligence environment.

Other Requirements

Solid knowledge of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards

Strong analytical, problem solving and judgment skills to be able to interpret data and identify, diagnose, and resolve KPI related issues

Excellent knowledge of office software, including Microsoft Data Warehouse and BI technologies, both Cloud and on-prem (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI Desktop, PowerBI Report Builder, PowerBI Service, Tableau etc.)

Experience maintaining ETL process using software such as SSIS would be an asset.

Strong time management, organization, verbal and written communication skills

Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities and work in a rapidly changing and dynamic environment with limited supervision

Strong relationship management skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams and management levels

Engaged listener: capable of listening and interpreting stakeholder feedback to understand business processes and identify business issues/objectives

Experience in process improvement or lean methodologies would be considered an asset

Experience supporting a data governance program would be considered an asset

Advanced knowledge of Business Intelligence tools

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

The salary for this position ranges from $75,600 - $113,400 per annum. Actual salary offered will be based on education, experience, skills, and qualifications as they relate to the role.

We aim to provide competitive pay that reflects your professional background and expertise. We want to ensure our offer will align with your strengths considering experience, skills, and internal equity to offer a fair and equitable salary. The Total Compensation Package, which includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan as well as other employment offerings will be discussed in detail as your application progresses.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to https://www.translink.ca/About-Us/Careers.aspx to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: May 09, 2025

Closing Date: Open until filled.

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Coast Mountain Bus Company is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca

Title: Senior Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people. We’re a global close-knit community, united by the relentless pursuit to help keep people safer everywhere. Our critical communications, video security and command center technologies support public safety agencies and enterprises alike, enabling the coordination that’s critical for safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals and safer businesses. Connect with a career that matters, and help us build a safer future.

Aperçu de l’entreprise

Chez Motorola Solutions, nous pensons que tout commence par nos employés. Nous sommes une communauté mondiale soudée, unie par la volonté incessante de contribuer à la sécurité des personnes partout dans le monde. Nos technologies de communication, de sécurité vidéo et de centre de commandement essentielles soutiennent les agences de sécurité publique et les entreprises, permettant une coordination essentielle pour des communautés, des écoles, des hôpitaux et des entreprises plus sécuritaires. Connectez-vous à une carrière qui compte et aidez-nous à bâtir un avenir plus sûr.

Department Overview

Motorola Solutions ﬁxed and mobile video, access control and software solutions, led by our Avigilon Alta, Avigilon Unity, Pelco & Envysion portfolios help you ﬁnd, analyze and share information so you can respond to events with speed and decisiveness to keep your people and property safe. Whether you are looking to deploy a new video security or access control solution, equip your team with body-worn cameras, or leverage analytics through purpose-built applications, we have solutions to meet your needs.

Job Description

Position Overview

This role involves leveraging data analytics to drive financial reporting, process automation, and strategic decision-making. A successful candidate will bridge technical data expertise with financial acumen, ensuring accurate reporting, system optimization, and proactive problem-solving within the finance function. The candidate will own data workflows from collection to visualization, demonstrating technical knowledge and strategic problem-solving capabilities.

Key Responsibilities


Oversee the preparation and delivery of financial reports for monthly/quarterly cycles, ensuring alignment with regulatory and organizational standards
Design, maintain, and optimize Power BI and Tableau dashboards for real-time financial performance tracking and stakeholder communication
Automate repetitive financial workflows (e.g., data collection, report generation) using Python, SQL, or low-code platforms like Power Automate
Act as the AI subject matter expert for the company by advising on ways to implement throughout the business
Proactively identify data discrepancies, system inefficiencies, or reporting gaps and implement corrective measures
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate financial data into actionable business insights
Develop predictive models to forecast financial trends and assess risk scenarios


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or related field
5+ years’ experience in financial data analysis


Technical qualifications:


Expert-level Power BI/Power Query development
Production-grade Python/SQL scripting (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Data modeling and warehouse architecture principles


Demonstrated ability to:


Simplify complex financial data for non-technical audiences
Troubleshoot system errors and implement technical solutions independently
Manage multiple priorities in deadline-driven environment
Knowledge of advanced analytics techniques for automation and process improvement
Background in developing self-service reporting tools for business teams


Differentiating Skills


Experience implementing machine learning workflows (predictive modeling, pattern recognition)
Knowledge of cloud analytics platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience incorporating AI strategies in reporting and business processes
Background in developing API integrations or data governance frameworks


Target Base Salary Range: $59,600 - $105,500 CAD

Consistent with Motorola Solutions values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. Pay within this range varies and depends on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The actual offer will be based on the individual candidate.

Basic Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree with 5+ years’ experience in financial data analysis


Travel Requirements

Under 10%

Relocation Provided

None

Position Type

Experienced

Referral Payment Plan

No

EEO Statement

Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally-protected characteristic.

We are proud of our people-first and community-focused culture, empowering every Motorolan to be their most authentic self and to do their best work to deliver on the promise of a safer world. If you’d like to join our team but feel that you don’t quite meet all of the preferred skills, we’d still love to hear why you think you’d be a great addition to our team.

We’re committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruiting experience for candidates with disabilities, or other physical or mental health conditions. To request an accommodation, please email ohr@motorolasolutions.com.

Motorola Solutions adopte, favorise et promeut les principes de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion. Nous encourageons et accueillons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées, quelles que soient leur race, origines ethnique, religion ou croyance, orientation sexuelle, identité et expression sexuelle, statut d’anciens combattants ou tout autre statut protégé par la Loi.

Nous sommes fiers de notre culture axée sur les personnes et les communautés, encourageant ainsi chaque Motorolan d’être la version la plus authentique de lui-même dans ses responsabilités afin de tenir la promesse d’un monde plus sécuritaire.

Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à notre communauté mais croyez que vous ne possédez pas toutes les exigences requises pour le poste convoité, nous aimerions tout de même connaître les raisons pour lesquelles vous pensez être un excellent candidat pour notre équipe.

Nous offrons également des mesures d’adaptation pendant toutes les étapes du processus d’embauche afin de favoriser l’inclusion des personnes vivant avec un handicap physique et/ou mental. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation, svp nous faire parvenir un courriel à ohr@motorolasolutions.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Caadsi
Description:
Salary

The salary range for this position is CAD $45.46 - $65.35 / hour

Job Summary

At Centre for Advanced Analytics, Data Science, and Innovation (CAADSI) department of Fraser Health, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our agile and fast paced team. Reporting to the Director, Analytics, you will identify, develop, implement and maintain innovative responses to the information and analytical needs of the organization as well as ensuring the department’s technical infrastructure is developed and sustained.

Job Duties:


Provides leadership in developing, processing, evaluating and reviewing information as well as providing interpretations and recommendations to all levels of the organization for decision-making purposes.
Acts as senior analytical resource to CAADSI, and provides senior expertise with respect to quality and performance measurement, best practices, evaluation, utilization management strategies, emerging analytics / technology trends, and information management and analysis.
Assesses, develops and evaluates the optimization of existing reporting procedures, explores automation opportunities, reduces redundancies and ensures analytic products offer actionable insight and interpretation.
Recommends departmental standards for database architecture and design; defines and maintains metadata; recommends requirements and standards for Extract Transformation and Load (ETL), including tools, methods and documentation.
Ensures that knowledge is transferred between Managing Consultants, Project Leaders, Data Analysts and other technical resources both before, during and after the development of decision support applications.
Liaises with clients in partnership with other members of System Optimization to understand business analytical needs, and develop both short- and long-term solutions through decision briefs and an analytical plan.
Provide detailed data narratives, identify key issues, and forecast trends to present to stakeholders to support strategic decision-making
Coordinates the exchange of data with various agencies, including but not limited to: Ministry of Health, Canadian Institute for Health Information, other Health Authorities, and external research groups.
Acts as a project manager for assigned analytics projects, including the development, monitoring, and evaluation of project plans and deliverables.


Qualifications:


Master's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field
Five (5) years of related experience in decision support tools, data analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, as well as experience in managing technical projects and directing technical staff
Proficiency in SQL, Python programming and data visualization tools (Power BI preferred)


An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

This position is located at our Central City office in Surrey, BC with a hybrid work model (2x/week in office)

Detailed Overview

Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

Reporting to the Director, Analytics, the Senior Data Analyst provides analytics leadership support to System Optimization; identifies, develops, implements and maintains innovative responses to the information and analytical needs of the organization, as well as ensuring the department's technical infrastructure is developed and sustained. This position synthesizes information and requests from all levels of the organization, including operational and clinical management, to provide analysis, interpretations and recommendations that have direct impact on decisions relating to the financial, human resources, and patient care services. Other responsibilities include administrative coordination and supervision to technical staff, project management and support, training, managing confidential information, user needs assessment and liaising with end users of decision support technology. Provides senior expertise with respect to quality and performance measurement and evaluation, reporting process optimization, development and implementation of practice standards, utilization management strategies and information management and analysis. Partners with other senior members of the department in liaising with staff and leadership across multiple clinical operations and corporate portfolios.

Responsibilities


Provides leadership in developing, processing, evaluating and reviewing information as well as providing interpretations and recommendations to all levels of the organization for decision-making purposes.
Acts as senior analytical resource to System Optimization, and provides senior expertise with respect to quality and performance measurement, best practices, evaluation, utilization management strategies, emerging analytics / technology trends, and information management and analysis.
Plans and coordinates quality assurance and quality control on the release of data for consistency with the organizational practices, including data definitions, metric calculations, reporting standards, and the protection of security and privacy.
Assesses, develops and evaluates the optimization of existing reporting procedures, explores automation opportunities, reduces redundancies and ensures analytic products offer actionable insight and interpretation.
Recommends departmental standards for database architecture and design; defines and maintains metadata; recommends requirements and standards for Extract Transformation and Load (ETL), including tools, methods and documentation.
Ensures that knowledge is transferred between Managing Consultants, Project Leaders, Data Analysts and other technical resources both before, during and after the development of decision support applications.
Identifies and monitors data quality issues within source systems and escalates the need to remedy to the data stewards for source systems.
Liaises with clients in partnership with other members of System Optimization to understand business analytical needs, and develop both short- and long-term solutions through decision briefs and an analytical plan.
Coordinates the exchange of data with various agencies, including but not limited to: Ministry of Health, Canadian Institute for Health Information, other Health Authorities, and external research groups.
Acts as a project manager for assigned analytics projects, including the development, monitoring, and evaluation of project plans and deliverables.
Provides supervision, coaching and mentorship to Data Analysts to support continuous learning, training, growth, and knowledge dissemination. Facilitates team-building and staff development by acting as an analytics role model and resource for the analytics team; determines appropriate assignment of staff resources; promotes collaborative work culture. advises the Managing Consultant of issues or concerns.
Works collaboratively and effectively with internal and external stakeholders to identify information needs and communicates those requirements to other System Optimization team members.


Qualifications

Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field, plus five (5) years of related experience in decision support tools, data analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, as well as experience in managing technical projects and directing technical staff, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Proficiency in T-SQL and Power BI is preferred.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.

Professional/Technical Capabilities


Advanced knowledge of decision support tools, big data analytics, statistics, and databases
General knowledge of current health care systems, issues and trends
Ability to exercise sound judgement, critical thinking and effective decision-making
Ability to analyze and problem-solve complex issues towards effective solutions
Ability to translate complex data analysis and communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with all levels of the organization, including advanced report presentation and writing skills
Effective project management skills to define deliverables and develop project plans
Effective facilitation and negotiation skills
Ability to respond to changing priorities and unforeseen circumstances
Ability to organize, prioritize and balance work
Ability to operate related equipment, including computer software applications
Working knowledge of PDSA, Lean, Six Sigma and other flow process improvement concepts
Physically ability to perform the duties of the position


About Fraser Health

Fraser Health is the heart of health care for over two million people in Metro Vancouver and the Fraser Valley in British Columbia, Canada, on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations and is home to 32 First Nations within the Fraser Salish region.

People - those we care for and those who care for them - are at the heart of everything we do. Our hospital and community-based services are delivered by a team of 48,000+ staff, medical staff and volunteers.

We are committed to planetary health and value diversity in the work force. We strive to maintain an environment of respect, caring and trust. Fraser Health’s hiring practices aspire to ensure all individuals are treated in an inclusive, equitable and culturally safe manner.

Together, we are the heart of health care.

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | X | Indeed | Glassdoor

IMPORTANT: Recruitment scam warning

Please be on alert for recruitment scams. We are aware of several scams targeting individuals by falsely claiming to represent Fraser Health. Always take precautions when sharing personal details with unverified sources. Please note that we will never ask for money or payment, nor ask you to download or install an app at any point during our recruitment process.

Qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field
  • Five (5) years of related experience in decision support tools, data analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, as well as experience in managing technical projects and directing technical staff
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python programming and data visualization tools (Power BI preferred)

An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

This position is located at our Central City office in Surrey, BC with a hybrid work model (2x/week in office)

Detailed Overview

Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

Reporting to the Director, Analytics, the Senior Data Analyst provides analytics leadership support to System Optimization; identifies, develops, implements and maintains innovative responses to the information and analytical needs of the organization, as well as ensuring the department's technical infrastructure is developed and sustained. This position synthesizes information and requests from all levels of the organization, including operational and clinical management, to provide analysis, interpretations and recommendations that have direct impact on decisions relating to the financial, human resources, and patient care services. Other responsibilities include administrative coordination and supervision to technical staff, project management and support, training, managing confidential information, user needs assessment and liaising with end users of decision support technology. Provides senior expertise with respect to quality and performance measurement and evaluation, reporting process optimization, development and implementation of practice standards, utilization management strategies and information management and analysis. Partners with other senior members of the department in liaising with staff and leadership across multiple clinical operations and corporate portfolios.

Responsibilities

  • Provides leadership in developing, processing, evaluating and reviewing information as well as providing interpretations and recommendations to all levels of the organization for decision-making purposes.
  • Acts as senior analytical resource to System Optimization, and provides senior expertise with respect to quality and performance measurement, best practices, evaluation, utilization management strategies, emerging analytics / technology trends, and information management and analysis.
  • Plans and coordinates quality assurance and quality control on the release of data for consistency with the organizational practices, including data definitions, metric calculations, reporting standards, and the protection of security and privacy.
  • Assesses, develops and evaluates the optimization of existing reporting procedures, explores automation opportunities, reduces redundancies and ensures analytic products offer actionable insight and interpretation.
  • Recommends departmental standards for database architecture and design; defines and maintains metadata; recommends requirements and standards for Extract Transformation and Load (ETL), including tools, methods and documentation.
  • Ensures that knowledge is transferred between Managing Consultants, Project Leaders, Data Analysts and other technical resources both before, during and after the development of decision support applications.
  • Identifies and monitors data quality issues within source systems and escalates the need to remedy to the data stewards for source systems.
  • Liaises with clients in partnership with other members of System Optimization to understand business analytical needs, and develop both short- and long-term solutions through decision briefs and an analytical plan.
  • Coordinates the exchange of data with various agencies, including but not limited to: Ministry of Health, Canadian Institute for Health Information, other Health Authorities, and external research groups.
  • Acts as a project manager for assigned analytics projects, including the development, monitoring, and evaluation of project plans and deliverables.
  • Provides supervision, coaching and mentorship to Data Analysts to support continuous learning, training, growth, and knowledge dissemination. Facilitates team-building and staff development by acting as an analytics role model and resource for the analytics team; determines appropriate assignment of staff resources; promotes collaborative work culture. advises the Managing Consultant of issues or concerns.
  • Works collaboratively and effectively with internal and external stakeholders to identify information needs and communicates those requirements to other System Optimization team members.

Qualifications

Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field, plus five (5) years of related experience in decision support tools, data analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, as well as experience in managing technical projects and directing technical staff, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Proficiency in T-SQL and Power BI is preferred.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.

Professional/Technical Capabilities

  • Advanced knowledge of decision support tools, big data analytics, statistics, and databases
  • General knowledge of current health care systems, issues and trends
  • Ability to exercise sound judgement, critical thinking and effective decision-making
  • Ability to analyze and problem-solve complex issues towards effective solutions
  • Ability to translate complex data analysis and communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with all levels of the organization, including advanced report presentation and writing skills
  • Effective project management skills to define deliverables and develop project plans
  • Effective facilitation and negotiation skills
  • Ability to respond to changing priorities and unforeseen circumstances
  • Ability to organize, prioritize and balance work
  • Ability to operate related equipment, including computer software applications
  • Working knowledge of PDSA, Lean, Six Sigma and other flow process improvement concepts
  • Physically ability to perform the duties of the position

About Fraser Health

Fraser Health is the heart of health care for over two million people in Metro Vancouver and the Fraser Valley in British Columbia, Canada, on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations and is home to 32 First Nations within the Fraser Salish region.

People - those we care for and those who care for them - are at the heart of everything we do. Our hospital and community-based services are delivered by a team of 48,000+ staff, medical staff and volunteers.

We are committed to planetary health and value diversity in the work force. We strive to maintain an environment of respect, caring and trust. Fraser Health’s hiring practices aspire to ensure all individuals are treated in an inclusive, equitable and culturally safe manner.

Together, we are the heart of health care.

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | X | Indeed | Glassdoor

IMPORTANT: Recruitment scam warning

Please be on alert for recruitment scams. We are aware of several scams targeting individuals by falsely claiming to represent Fraser Health. Always take precautions when sharing personal details with unverified sources. Please note that we will never ask for money or payment, nor ask you to download or install an app at any point during our recruitment process.
